title: Why do we use oils in food? - Quora

response.answer_text: For their intrinsic nutritional value;for their sensual texture and aroma;as a medium to conserve moisture in meats and vegetables in roasting and grilling;for their effect in conserving a moist, tender texture (and extending freshness) in both raised and chemically leavened baked goods;for enabling an even and penetrating caramelization in both pan-frying and deep-frying;and—of course—to ward off various ingredients’ bonding to heated vessels during searing, frying, braising, or baking.On the other hand, they are the bane of calorie counters, are fire hazards, and can present challenges in the clean-up.

Oil are actually fats and fat is also essential for balanced diet,too much of fat is harmful but required amount is essential for proper growth,Vitamins - some are water soluble while others are fat soluble ,so fat not only imparts taste to our food but is also an essential component and it is fine if taken in the required amount.
